amendment.description: An amendment numbered 16 printed in the Congressional Record to insert in title III, under the heading "Office for State and Local Government Coordination and Preparedness__State and local programs "Provided further that the amount of any grant to a State in excess of any statutorily required minimum amount shall be made on the basis of an assessment of the risk of terrorism with respect to threat, vulnerability and consequences".

action.text: Mr. Rogers (KY) raised a point of order against the Sweeney amendment (A006). Amendment changes existing law and constitutes legislation in an appropriations bill. The Chair sustained the point of order.
